N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 101.1 - Special entertainment permits for minors

State Regulations
(a) Any person under the age of 18 may apply
to the authority for a special permit to appear as an entertainer on premises
licensed to sell alcoholic beverages at retail. (b) Such permit shall be issued in the
authority's discretion and shall not be issued if the authority finds that the
entertainment that the applicant is intending to perform may be contrary to the
applicant's best interests. (c) No
such permit shall be issued unless there appears on the application the written
consent of both parents or the lawful guardian or guardians of such
minor. (d) Except for good cause
shown to the authority's satisfaction, no such permit shall be issued to any
person under the age of 16 unless such person has been issued a child
performer's permit pursuant to section
3229
of the

Education Law. (e) In addition to
such other information as may be required by the authority, such application
shall contain a description of the entertainment the minor intends to perform, as well as a description of any other entertainment to be offered in the
licensed premises during the minor's proposed appearance. (f) Such permit shall be valid only for the
date or dates specified in the application, and for performances only at the
licensed premises specified therein. In no event shall such permit be issued
for a period exceeding one year. (g) There shall be no fee imposed for any
such permit. (h) No such permit
shall be valid for any appearance unless a parent or legal guardian of the
minor is present throughout such appearance. Any such appearance without the
presence of such parent or guardian may constitute a violation of section
100
(2-b)
of the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law, by the licensee. (i) Such permit
may be revoked by the authority for cause, and shall be revoked, without a
hearing, promptly upon the written request of the minor's parents or legal
guardian. (j) No such permit shall
be required in connection with any appearance by a minor which is otherwise
permitted by section
100
(2-b)
of the Alcoholic Beverage Control

Law. Notes
